attributes.action: Stop the RAF Voyager plane used by the PM being painted red, white and blue.
attributes.additional_details:
Number 10's spokesperson has argued that the £900,000 paint job represents 'value for money'.

Spending nearly £1 million on branding an RAF plane for the Prime Minister in the hope that this will help Great Britain's standing overseas, cannot be justified.

When people in the UK are losing their jobs to coronavirus, it's immoral.

Furthermore, painting the plane red, white and blue, rather than grey, will make it more difficult for the Voyager to be used by the RAF during emergencies.
attributes.background:
The government is repainting the prime ministerial plane in Union Jack colours, at a cost to the taxpayer of £900,000.

There are hundreds of better things that nearly £1 million could be spent on - such as giving nurses a pay rise.

rejection.details:
By the time your petition was started, the plane had already been painted. It's not clear what action can be taken now.

You might like to sign and share one of these petitions instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073
